newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia govt maintains big poll lead.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia govt maintains big poll lead.

text.p: Australia's Liberal-National government has maintained its strong lead over the Labor opposition in a major opinion poll published on Tuesday.
Support for Prime Minster John Howard's government was 49 percent, 13 points ahead of Labor's 36 percent backing, The Australian newspaper's Newspoll found.
Howard also continued to strongly lead opposition leader Kim Beazley as preferred prime minister -- 51 percent to 22 percent.

But the government's lead and Howard's lead narrowed from the previous poll, two weeks ago, the survey said. Support for the government slipped from 51 percent, while Labor's backing increased two points from 34 percent in the last survey.

And while Beazley's rating as preferred prime minister remained unchanged, Howard's backing dropped three points from 54 per cent. The latest results compare with the government's primary vote of 47.3 percent and Labor's 38.8 percent in the March 2 national election that ended 13 years of Labor rule.
The Newspoll surveyed 1,151 voters around the country by telephone last weekend.
